intro: Antonia griffithii, commonly known as the Griffith's antonia, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and habitat loss. Conservation efforts are essential to protect this unique botanical species.
